hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via 7-Day Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) and its 7-day realized volatility compresses below 35% (annualized) for 3 consecutive days, a breakout above the 20-day high on >1.5x average volume signals a transition to BULL regime with 85% probability over the next 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes significant directional moves. The combination of low volatility, high volume breakout, and neutral regime provides a high-probability setup for bull transitions. Regulatory clarity (MiCA) may reduce uncertainty, allowing compressed markets to resolve upward.
entry_conditions: BTC 7-day realized volatility <35% for 3 consecutive days
Volume on breakout day >1.5x 30-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% gain from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confidence >75%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 4% loss from entry OR volatility expands >60% without directional move

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain >3 days OR regime transitions to BEAR within 5 days despite breakout conditions
